title: Donald Trump is asking friends how his campaign is performing: 'Unfair that I beat him and now...'
content: Former president and GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump is now complaining relentlessly and grown increasingly upset about Kamala Harris' surging poll numbers and media coverage. According to a Washington Post report, Donald Trump told an ally last week on phone that it's unfair that he beat Joe Biden and now he has to beat Kamala Harris too. Trump is asking his friends how his campaign is performing, the report said.
summary: Former president and GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump is now complaining relentlessly and grown increasingly upset about Kamala Harris' surging poll numbers and media coverage. According to a Washington Post report, Donald Trump told an ally last week on phone that it's unfair that he beat Joe Biden and now he has to beat Kamala Harris too. Trump is asking his friends how his campaign is performing, the report said.

title: 'Stolen valor' row: Tim Walz said he carried weapons; 'When, which war,' JD Vance's counter
content: The military record of Kamala Harris' running mate Tim Walz came under scrutiny as his rival JD Vance said if one does not go to the war, then he can't claim that he served in the military. JD Vance said Tim Walz dropped out of the army and took retirement in 2005 before his unit was deployed in Iraq.
summary: The military record of Kamala Harris' running mate Tim Walz came under scrutiny as his rival JD Vance said if one does not go to the war, then he can't claim that he served in the military. JD Vance said Tim Walz dropped out of the army and took retirement in 2005 before his unit was deployed in Iraq.

title: JD Vance was asked whether he knows what 'Kamabla' means. His reply is....
content: Former president and GOP presidential candidate Donald has a new nickname for Kamala Harris 'Kamabla' which made its first appearance on Monday in Trump's Truth Social post. "People cote with their STOMACH, and food is now at an all time high because of Kamabla/Biden INCOMPETENCE. With them in charge, IT WILL ONLY GET WORSE" -- this was the post. And it was not a typo as Kamala was Kamabla since then.
summary: Former president and GOP presidential candidate Donald has a new nickname for Kamala Harris 'Kamabla' which made its first appearance on Monday in Trump's Truth Social post. title: US weekly jobless claims fall more than expected in latest week
Trump will hold a news conference in his first public appearance since rival Harris picked Walz
content: Former President Donald Trump announced a press conference at Mar-a-Lago, marking his first public appearance after Kamala Harris became the Democratic presidential nominee with Tim Walz as her running mate. Trump, criticized Harris for not holding a news conference since her campaign launch, indicated his willingness to debate her in the forthcoming presidential debate.
summary: Former President Donald Trump announced a press conference at Mar-a-Lago, marking his first public appearance after Kamala Harris became the Democratic presidential nominee with Tim Walz as her running mate. Trump, criticized Harris for not holding a news conference since her campaign launch, indicated his willingness to debate her in the forthcoming presidential debate.

title: Trump took a private flight with Project 2025 director in 2022, reveals new photo
content: Donald Trump has categorically denied having anything to do with controversial Project 2025 but the controversy is far from dying down as now a photo of Trump with Kevin Roberts, the president of Heritage Foundation has surfaced. Reports said Trump took a 45-minute private flight with Kevin Roberts, which was not reported earlier.
summary: Donald Trump has categorically denied having anything to do with controversial Project 2025 but the controversy is far from dying down as now a photo of Trump with Kevin Roberts, the president of Heritage Foundation has surfaced. Reports said Trump took a 45-minute private flight with Kevin Roberts, which was not reported earlier.

title: First murder in 20 years in this town of US is straight out of a horror movie
High hopes for change as Bangladeshis welcome new leader Yunus home
content: Three days after a student-led uprising forced the autocratic premier to flee, Bangladeshis welcomed Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus as the caretaker government leader. Yunus faces significant challenges, including corruption and law enforcement, but hopes for democracy and stability are high. His international reputation and lack of political entanglements are seen as assets for the country's future.
summary: Three days after a student-led uprising forced the autocratic premier to flee, Bangladeshis welcomed Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus as the caretaker government leader. Yunus faces significant challenges, including corruption and law enforcement, but hopes for democracy and stability are high. His international reputation and lack of political entanglements are seen as assets for the country's future.

title: China confirms discovering world's first large shallow gas field in disputed South China Sea
content: China discovered a major gas field exceeding 100 billion cubic meters in the South China Sea, potentially escalating regional disputes. The Lingshui 36-1 gas field, confirmed by the China National Offshore Oil Corporation, could heighten tensions with nations like the Philippines and Vietnam. This adds to the contentious nature of the resource-rich and strategically significant South China Sea.
summary: China discovered a major gas field exceeding 100 billion cubic meters in the South China Sea, potentially escalating regional disputes. The Lingshui 36-1 gas field, confirmed by the China National Offshore Oil Corporation, could heighten tensions with nations like the Philippines and Vietnam. This adds to the contentious nature of the resource-rich and strategically significant South China Sea.

title: 'My life's mission': Pelosi vows to keep Donald Trump out of White House
Taylor Swift's Vienna shows cancelled; Austrian authorities discover chemicals in terror attack suspect's home
content: Austria cancels Taylor Swift concerts in Vienna after terror threat, seizes chemicals from suspect home
summary: Austria cancels Taylor Swift concerts in Vienna after terror threat, seizes chemicals from suspect home

title: Explained: Why are people protesting in the UK? What sparked the outrage?
content: A wave of riots erupted across the UK, triggered by a tragic knife attack in Southport, leading to violent anti-immigration demonstrations. Misidentification of the attacker, hailing from Rwandan parents, fueled misinformation and clashes. Both far-right groups and anti-racism protesters took to the streets, resulting in numerous arrests and judicial actions. PM Starmer condemned the unrest.
summary: A wave of riots erupted across the UK, triggered by a tragic knife attack in Southport, leading to violent anti-immigration demonstrations. Misidentification of the attacker, hailing from Rwandan parents, fueled misinformation and clashes. Both far-right groups and anti-racism protesters took to the streets, resulting in numerous arrests and judicial actions. PM Starmer condemned the unrest.

title: UK Supreme Court upholds citizenship revocation for 'IS bride' Shamima Begum
content: Shamima Begum, who left London at 15 to join Islamic State in Syria, lost her appeal against the UK government's decision to revoke her British citizenship on national security grounds. The courts ruled that her potential victimization as a trafficking victim did not outweigh national security concerns, leaving her with Bangladeshi citizenship.
summary: Shamima Begum, who left London at 15 to join Islamic State in Syria, lost her appeal against the UK government's decision to revoke her British citizenship on national security grounds. The courts ruled that her potential victimization as a trafficking victim did not outweigh national security concerns, leaving her with Bangladeshi citizenship.

title: Australian teacher Tayla Brailey arrested for sexually harassing student
Tropical storm Debby: Coastal flooding, tornadoes and power outages ravage southern states in US
content: Tropical Storm Debby triggered massive rainfall and tornadoes in Georgia and the Carolinas, leading to severe flooding and dam breaches. Emergency services rescued over 75 individuals. The storm impacted regions up to New York and New Jersey, causing significant power outages and water rescues. At least six fatalities were reported across affected areas.
summary: Tropical Storm Debby triggered massive rainfall and tornadoes in Georgia and the Carolinas, leading to severe flooding and dam breaches. Emergency services rescued over 75 individuals. The storm impacted regions up to New York and New Jersey, causing significant power outages and water rescues. At least six fatalities were reported across affected areas.

title: Israel vows to eliminate new Hamas chief; stokes fears of deepening Gaza War
content: Israel pledged to remove Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, accused of masterminding the October 7 assault. The Gaza war’s intensity grows with Sinwar’s appointment. Israel is prepared for potential Iranian retaliation following the assassination of Sinwar’s predecessor. Sinwar’s leadership and hardline approach suggests a less likely ceasefire, impacting residents in Israel and Gaza.
summary: Israel pledged to remove Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, accused of masterminding the October 7 assault. The Gaza war’s intensity grows with Sinwar’s appointment. Israel is prepared for potential Iranian retaliation following the assassination of Sinwar’s predecessor. Sinwar’s leadership and hardline approach suggests a less likely ceasefire, impacting residents in Israel and Gaza.

title: 'I murdered him really badly': Connecticut man kills father, leaves organs outside body
content: Steven James Uricchio, 31, was charged with the brutal murder of his father, Marc Uricchio, in Ridgefield. The town's first murder in over 20 years, it has deeply unsettled the community. Uricchio, who confessed to the crime, is undergoing a competency evaluation and is being held on $1.5 million bail.
summary: Steven James Uricchio, 31, was charged with the brutal murder of his father, Marc Uricchio, in Ridgefield. The town's first murder in over 20 years, it has deeply unsettled the community. Uricchio, who confessed to the crime, is undergoing a competency evaluation and is being held on $1.5 million bail.

title: Jack Karlson, man behind 'Succulent Chinese Meal' 'Democracy Manifest' viral video dies at 82
content: Jack Karlson, famous for the viral 'democracy manifest' clip, passed away at 82 due to prostate cancer. He shot to internet fame after a dramatic 1991 arrest over mistaken identity, which went viral in 2009. His niece, Kim Edwards, had started a GoFundMe for his medical bills prior to his death. A documentary is set for release in 2025.
summary: Jack Karlson, famous for the viral 'democracy manifest' clip, passed away at 82 due to prostate cancer. He shot to internet fame after a dramatic 1991 arrest over mistaken identity, which went viral in 2009. His niece, Kim Edwards, had started a GoFundMe for his medical bills prior to his death. A documentary is set for release in 2025.
